item.title: NPC Standing and Walking Animations Explained
item.dc:creator: @dwarvenknight dwarvenknight
item.description:
@dwarvenknight wrote:

Let’s look at a code rom Class5.java…

if(i == XXXX) { // NPC ID aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; class5.anIntArray94 = new int[5]; int changedColors = 1; class5.anIntArray76 = new int[changedColors]; class5.anIntArray70 = new int[changedColors]; class5.anIntArray76[0] = 61; class5.anIntArray70[0] = 926; class5.anIntArray94[0] = 10482; class5.anIntArray94[1] = 10483; class5.anIntArray94[2] = 10484; class5.anIntArray94[3] = 10485; class5.anIntArray94[4] = 10486; class5.aString65 = "Test"; // NPC name class5.anInt61 = 99; //Combat level class5.aByteArray89 = "A test NPC.".getBytes(); // NPC description }

Under:

class5.anInt61 = 650; //Combat level

Add these:

class5.anInt77 = XX; class5.anInt67 = XX; class5.anInt83 = XX;

class5.anInt77 = Standing animation;
class5.anInt67 = Walking animation;
class5.anInt83 = Side walking animation;

I hope this helped.

Read full topic
item.source: NPC Standing and Walking Animations Explained
